intro: Rinorea oraria, commonly known as the silverleaf oraria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery-white pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. Rinorea oraria is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
